Perform repeated sampling

Perform repeated sampling of samples of size n. Useful for creating sampling distributions

rep_sample_n(tbl, size, replace = FALSE, reps = 1, prob = NULL)

Arguments

tbl

data frame of population from which to sample
size

sample size of each sample
replace

should sampling be with replacement?
reps

number of samples of size n = size to take
prob

a vector of probability weights for obtaining the elements of the vector being sampled.

Value

A tibble of size rep times size rows corresponding to rep samples of size n = size from tbl.

Examples

library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:testthat’:
#> 
#>     matches
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’:
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’:
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
library(ggplot2)

# Create a virtual population of N = 2400 balls, of which 900 are red and the
# rest are white
N <- 2400
population <- data_frame(
  ball_ID = 1:N,
  color = c(rep("red", 900), rep("white", N - 900))
)
population
#> # A tibble: 2,400 x 2
#>    ball_ID color
#>      <int> <chr>
#>  1       1 red  
#>  2       2 red  
#>  3       3 red  
#>  4       4 red  
#>  5       5 red  
#>  6       6 red  
#>  7       7 red  
#>  8       8 red  
#>  9       9 red  
#> 10      10 red  
#> # ... with 2,390 more rows

# Take samples of size n = 50 balls; do this 1000 times
samples <- population %>%
  rep_sample_n(size = 50, reps = 1000)
samples
#> # A tibble: 50,000 x 3
#> # Groups:   replicate [1,000]
#>    replicate ball_ID color
#>        <int>   <int> <chr>
#>  1         1    1045 white
#>  2         1    1796 white
#>  3         1     269 red  
#>  4         1    2276 white
#>  5         1    1574 white
#>  6         1    2389 white
#>  7         1     494 red  
#>  8         1    1660 white
#>  9         1    1601 white
#> 10         1     562 red  
#> # ... with 49,990 more rows

# Compute p_hats for all 1000 samples = proportion red
p_hats <- samples %>%
  group_by(replicate) %>%
  summarize(prop_red = mean(color == "red"))
p_hats
#> # A tibble: 1,000 x 2
#>    replicate prop_red
#>        <int>    <dbl>
#>  1         1    0.300
#>  2         2    0.440
#>  3         3    0.320
#>  4         4    0.360
#>  5         5    0.380
#>  6         6    0.340
#>  7         7    0.380
#>  8         8    0.320
#>  9         9    0.360
#> 10        10    0.440
#> # ... with 990 more rows

# Plot sampling distribution
ggplot(p_hats, aes(x = prop_red)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.05) +
  labs(x = "p_hat", y = "Number of samples",
  title = "Sampling distribution of p_hat based on 1000 samples of size n = 50")
